p: Our simulations suggest variable contributions of different life-history traits to population growth along the pond permanence gradient. While sensitivity and elasticity analysis showed that the survival rate of new eggs increases in importance in long-lived pools, the positive effect of survival of older eggs from the egg bank increases as hydroperiods decrease ( Fig. 2, Fig. S3). This implies that the egg bank plays a more prominent role for population persistence in short-lived compared to long-lived pools, matching theoretical predictions 9 10 11. Short-lived pools typically also have higher levels of habitat uncertainty 5, driving selection for lower hatching fractions as part of a bet hedging strategy 12 and increasing the importance of survival in the egg bank 10.
